definition: foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks

sentences.english: Use the entire weight of your back leg and hip to push into the outside of your back foot.
sentences.chinese: 使用你後腿的所有重量並上提拉進後腳的外側。

sentences.english: But there is just one set of back feet and one tail.
sentences.chinese: 但是牠們只有一雙後腳和一隻尾巴。

sentences.english: Tom Kitten was quite unable to jump when walking upon his hind legs in trousers.
sentences.chinese: 用穿着褲子的後腳走路的湯姆小貓並不太能夠跳躍。

sentences.english: Her feet sent back a continual spatter of mud .
sentences.chinese: 她的後腳不斷濺起泥漿。

sentences.english: Pick up your back knee, balancing on the ball of the back foot.
sentences.chinese: 擡起你的後膝，平衡在後腳的大腳趾球。

sentences.english: There are five claws on the forefeet and four on the rear.
sentences.chinese: 它們的前腳有五枚爪子，後腳則爲四枚。

sentences.english: The glands on its hind feet can secrete poisonous fluid.
sentences.chinese: 它後腳上的腺體能分泌出毒液來。

sentences.english: The kangaroo uses its back legs to jump.
sentences.chinese: 袋鼠是用牠的後腳在跳。

sentences.english: Absence of double dewclaws on each rear leg.
sentences.chinese: 後腳的後方缺少各二隻的懸空狼爪。

sentences.english: Walk on the zebra crossing step by step with rear foot tip against the front foot heel.
sentences.chinese: 每一步都後腳尖頂着前腳跟這樣的走過斑馬線。

definition: to draw to oneself/to gather up/to collect/to fold up (an umbrella, wings etc)/to assemble (a party of persons)/to rope in (some people)
